problem_text:
An automorphism φ of the free group Fn on the free generators x1, x2, . . . , xn is called conjugating if xφ_i = t−1_i xπ(i)ti, i = 1, 2, . . . , n, for some permutation π ∈ Sn and some elements ti ∈ Fn. The set of conjugating automorphisms fixing the product x1x2 · · · xn forms the braid group Bn. The group Bn is linear for any n ⩾ 2, while the group of all automorphisms Aut Fn is not linear for n ⩾ 3. Is the group of all conjugating automorphisms linear for n ⩾ 3?
V. G. Bardakov
